remixlab.bias.core

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionAgent

    public class Agent
extends Object
    An Agent is a high-level BogusEvent parser, which holds a pool() of grabbers: application objects implementing (user-defined) actions. The agent also holds an inputGrabber() which is the object in the pool() that grabs input at a given time, i.e., the targeted object in the call handle(BogusEvent).

    The agent's inputGrabber() may be set by querying the pool with updateTrackedGrabber(BogusEvent). Each object in the pool will then check if the Grabber.checkIfGrabsInput(BogusEvent)) condition is met. The first object meeting the condition will be set as the inputGrabber() and it may be null if no object meets it. An inputGrabber() may also simply be enforced with setDefaultGrabber(Grabber).

    There are non-generic and generic agents. Non-generic agents (like this one) simply act as a channel between bogus events and grabbers. In this case, the agent simply transmits the (raw) bogus event to its inputGrabber(). More specialized, generic, agents also hold Profiles, each containing a mapping between bogus event shortcuts and user-defined actions. Generic agents thus parse bogus events to determine the user-defined action the inputGrabber() should perform (see handle(BogusEvent)).

    This class is the base class of both, generic and non-generic agents. Generic agents are found at the remixlab.bias.agent package.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        public String name()
        Returns:
        Agents name

      • isTracking

        public boolean isTracking()
        Returns true if this agent is tracking its grabbers.

        You may need to enableTracking() first.

      • enableTracking

        public void enableTracking()
        Enables tracking so that the inputGrabber() may be updated when calling updateTrackedGrabber(BogusEvent).
        See Also:
        disableTracking()

      • disableTracking

        public void disableTracking()
        Disables tracking.
        See Also:
        enableTracking()

      • setTracking

        public void setTracking(boolean enable)
        Sets the isTracking() value.

      • toggleTracking

        public void toggleTracking()
        Calls setTracking(boolean) to toggle the isTracking() value.

      • updateTrackedGrabber

        public Grabber updateTrackedGrabber(BogusEvent event)
        If isTracking() is enabled and the agent is registered at the inputHandler() then queries each object in the pool() to check if the Grabber.checkIfGrabsInput(BogusEvent)) condition is met. The first object meeting the condition will be set as the inputGrabber() and returned. Note that a null grabber means that no object in the pool() met the condition. A inputGrabber() may also be enforced simply with setDefaultGrabber(Grabber).

        Note you don't have to call this method since the inputHandler() handler does it automatically every frame.

        Parameters:
        event - to query the pool()
        Returns:
        the new grabber which may be null.
        See Also:
        setDefaultGrabber(Grabber), isTracking()

      • enqueueEventTuple

        public void enqueueEventTuple(EventGrabberTuple eventTuple)
        Convenience function that simply calls enqueueEventTuple(eventTuple, true).
        See Also:
        enqueueEventTuple(EventGrabberTuple, boolean)

      • enqueueEventTuple

        public void enqueueEventTuple(EventGrabberTuple eventTuple,
                     boolean checkNullAction)
        Calls InputHandler.enqueueEventTuple(EventGrabberTuple) to enqueue the EventGrabberTuple for later execution. If checkNullAction is true the tuple will be enqueued only if event tuple action is non-null.

        Note that this method is automatically called by handle(BogusEvent).

        See Also:
        handle(BogusEvent)

      • info

        public String info()
        Returns a detailed description of this Agent as a String.

      • handle

        public void handle(BogusEvent event)
        Main agent method. Non-generic agents (like this one) simply call inputHandler().enqueueEventTuple(new EventGrabberTuple(event, grabber())).

        Generic agents parse the bogus event to determine the user-defined action the inputGrabber() should perform.

        Note that the agent must be registered at the inputHandler() for this method to take effect.

        See Also:
        inputGrabber()

      • feed

        public BogusEvent feed()
        Callback (user-space) event reduction routine. Obtains data from the outside world and returns a BogusEvent i.e., reduces external data into a BogusEvent. Automatically call by the main event loop ( InputHandler.handle()). See ProScene's Space-Navigator example.
        See Also:
        InputHandler.handle()

      • inputHandler

        public InputHandler inputHandler()
        Returns the InputHandler this agent is registered to.

      • pool

        public List<Grabber> pool()
        Returns a list containing references to all the active grabbers.

        Used to parse all the grabbers and to check if any of them Grabber.grabsInput(Agent).

      • removeFromPool

        public boolean removeFromPool(Grabber grabber)
        Removes the grabber from the pool().

        See addInPool(Grabber) for details. Removing a grabber that is not in pool() has no effect.

      • clearPool

        public void clearPool()
        Clears the pool().

        Use this method only if it is faster to clear the pool() and then to add back a few grabbers than to remove each one independently.

      • isInPool

        public boolean isInPool(Grabber grabber)
        Returns true if the grabber is currently in the agents pool() list.

        When set to false using removeFromPool(Grabber), the handler no longer Grabber.checkIfGrabsInput(BogusEvent) on this grabber. Use addInPool(Grabber) to insert it * back.

      • trackedGrabber

        public Grabber trackedGrabber()
        Returns the grabber set after updateTrackedGrabber(BogusEvent) is called. It may be null.

      • inputGrabber

        public Grabber inputGrabber()
        If trackedGrabber() is non null, returns it. Otherwise returns the defaultGrabber().
        See Also:
        trackedGrabber()

      • defaultGrabber

        public Grabber defaultGrabber()
        Default inputGrabber() returned when trackedGrabber() is null and set with setDefaultGrabber(Grabber).
        See Also:
        inputGrabber(), trackedGrabber()

      • setDefaultGrabber

        public void setDefaultGrabber(Grabber grabber)
        Sets the defaultGrabber() inputGrabber()

      • addInPool

        public boolean addInPool(Grabber grabber)
        Adds the grabber in the pool().

        Use removeFromPool(Grabber) to remove the grabber from the pool, so that it is no longer tested with Grabber.checkIfGrabsInput(BogusEvent) by the handler, and hence can no longer grab the agent focus. Use isInPool(Grabber) to know the current state of the grabber.
